company_overview: Senior-Big Data Software Engineer                    AT&T                                  Alpharetta, GA              On-site                3 weeks ago                                    4 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Telecommunications136 school alumniSee how you compare to 4 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Senior-Big Data Software Engineer at AT&T
Title: Senior-Big Data Software Engineer
JD:
About the job
    


          At AT&T we bring the world together with technology in ways you never imagined. With a range of products and services enhancing how you live, play and work, we’re keeping you connected to the future. We rely on the latest in data sciences and engineering to curate, analyze and improve our customer experience and operations.
The Opportunity
The Data Science team at AT&T strives to lead transformation through data-driven decisions that advance the customer experience and businesses around the world. With access to one of the coolest and largest data sets available, we enable the discovery and development of meaningful insights that inspire continuous innovation.
We are seeking an experienced self-driven software engineer who is comfortable being part of a small skunk works team responsible for building, designing, and end-to-end ownership of a scalable software product tasked to deliver intelligent data driven products.
Responsible for the development of high performance, scalable, distributed computing tasks using Java, Scala, Python and other distributed environment technologies.
Key Roles and Responsibilities
Uses big data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Utilize self-service ingestion mechanisms to create automated ingestion pipelines, including error checks and notifications. Aggregate multiple disparate datasets to create datasets for modelling and feature creation consumption. Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented. Works in a highly agile environment. Manages day to day work and deliverables .
Qualifications
Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Scientific Computing preferred. Requires 5 - 8 years experience. Hands on experience using Python, Scala, Java, SQL, and popular back-end frameworks. Knowledge of telecom Datasets. Experience with Azure cloud services. Strong communication skills – communicating with all levels of management, understanding business requirements, and defining project roadmaps.
Our Senior Big Data Software Engineers earn between $128,500 - 160,000 not to mention all the other amazing rewards that working at AT&T offers. From health insurance to tuition reimbursement and paid time off to discounts on products and services just to name a few. There is a lot to be excited about around here. Individual starting salary within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training. This position will be filled in Alpharetta, Georgia or Plano, Texas. Ready for your #LifeAtATT? Apply now.
#ChiefDataOffice
JobCategory:Technology

company_overview: Data Analyst (Government)                    AT&T                                  Columbia, MD                               7 months ago                                    47 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Telecommunications136 school alumniSee how you compare to 47 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Data Analyst (Government) at AT&T
Title: Data Analyst (Government)
JD:
About the job
    


          AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Federal Government. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers’ mission.
Our National Security Team supports our Nation’s Intelligence Community (IC), with specific emphasis on delivering advanced networking, big data, and cyber analytic capabilities.
AT&T has an opening for a data analyst who is passionate about driving business decisions based on data. They will join a team that has provided exemplary support for a government customer’s classified network for over twenty years. This individual will play a critical role in defining analytic techniques for managing emerging capabilities, as well as provide analytic support for legacy program functionality.
 Job Duties/Responsibilities: 
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsIntegrate data from multiple sources, design and implement new tools and techniques for measuring and improving program productivityMaintain current monitoring capabilities, detect and troubleshoot network problems and traffic anomaliesMake recommendations for optimization when resources are limited and provide input to capacity and capability planning processes. They will be expected to come up to speed very quickly, develop a broad understanding of a complicated network and participate in decision-making as the network evolves. 

Required Clearance:
TSSCI and poly (#ts/sci) (#polygraph)
Required Qualifications:
Track record of innovative and successful approaches to data analysis, statistical analysis, pattern recognition, or intrusion detection . 3+ years of data analysis, statistical analysis, modeling or simulation techniques. 3+ yrs experience in Unix or Linux environments using Unix scripting languages (e.g., perl, python or awk). In-depth experience with both TDM and IP protocols and applications. Ability to work independently as well as part of a team that includes remotely located colleagues. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including ability to present highly technical material in an accessible manner. Education: MS in any STEM field (or equivalent experience)

Desired Qualifications:
Cybersecurity expertise, Experience writing requirements, Protocol analysis, Working knowledge of basic statistics, Familiarity with BGP and/or other routing protocols, Familiarity with AT&T Architecture.
Ready to join our team? Apply today!
JobCategory:Technology

company_overview: Senior-Big Data Engineer                    AT&T                                  Alpharetta, GA                               2 months ago                                    9 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Telecommunications136 school alumniSee how you compare to 9 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Senior-Big Data Engineer at AT&T
Title: Senior-Big Data Engineer
JD:
About the job
    


          Collaborate with critical stakeholders to understand business needs, priority, and the quality of services to be created or enhanced within a CDO data platform target architecture framework (both Azure and AWS). Develop the necessary enablers and data platform in the multi cloud Big Data Lake environment and maintain its integrity during the life cycle phases. Drive solution to be compliant with CDO target state architecture. Support key IAAS/PAAS/SAAS functions around the CDO big data cloud platform solutions. Deliver framework which can blueprint different subscriptions and be compliant with AT&T standards and security policies built with the principle focus on automation, reusability and self-service. Develop mechanisms to ingest, analyze, validate, normalize and clean data. Develop and maintain data engineering best practices and contribute to insights on data analytics and visualization concepts, methods and techniques. Support automation and engineering around CDO core shared services on the cloud for account/subscription mgmt., architecture and security patterns, ci/cd pipeline and orchestration, Astra security and compliance, Nifi, TWS, interfaces (data router, message router, Connect Direct, Golden Gate etc). Develop and configure IT solutions to streamline the continuous integration pipeline. Design and develop test automation to validate the code builds in CI pipeline using Jenkins. Contribute to the design and implementation of continuous integration and delivery processes and systems for highly available and performant application stacks. Create and maintain highly scalable and fault tolerant multi-tier AWS and Azure environments spanning across multiple availability zones using Terraform and CloudFormation. Deploy and maintain ELK cluster both managed and stand-alone clusters with Nginx/LDAP authentication. Develop Ansible playbooks for remote orchestration of multiple cloud resources. Interact with development teams, product and customers. Engineer operational requirements, test cases, technical documentation to provide operational support. Maintain, & support cloud solutions Ensure standard processes exist for systems installation, configuration, patching, and upgrading. Write terraform scripts from scratch for building Dev, Staging, Prod and DR environments. Troubleshoot application issues to determine network routing and load balancing issues. Tune TCP profiles for various applications like batch jobs and application load balancing. Evaluate TLS/SSL profiles, protocol levels (TLS 1.2, 1.1) and ciphers, restricting ciphers for security. Utilize Hybrid cloud environments both AWS & Azure. Use AWS services like EC2, ELB, Lambda, Route53, EKS, Active Directory, VPC, IAM, AMI, S3 and RDS. Utilize Azure services like VM, VMSS, Vnets, AKS, LBs, PLS.PLE, DNS Zones, Storage Accounts, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics. Utilize monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana & Alertmanager. Utilize Cloud Compliance tools like Astra and patching the virtual machines. Implement centralized monitoring and alerting systems across multiple cloud environments both AWS & Azure. Use Docker containers and Kubernetes Containerized solutions both on-prem and on Cloud environments. Utilize CI/CD technologies using Jenkins pipeline build and deployments for automation and builds. Use Terraform & CloudFormation for automated cloud infra deployments. Use Data movement tools/technologies like SFTP, Connect Direct. Build and configuring NIFI environments. Utilize scripting languages like Shell, PowerSHell, Python, Bash.
Requires a Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Information Technology and Five (5) Years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or Five (5) Years of progressive, post-baccalaureate of experience: developing mechanisms to ingest, analyze, validate, normalize and clean data; developing and maintaining data engineering best practices and contribute to insights on data analytics and visualization concepts, methods and techniques; utilizng Hybrid cloud environments both AWS & Azure; using AWS services like EC2, ELB, Lambda, Route53, EKS, Active Directory, VPC, IAM, AMI, S3 and RDS; utilizng Azure services like VM, VMSS, Vnets, AKS, LBs, PLS.PLE, DNS Zones, Storage Accounts, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics; utilizing monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana & Alertmanager; utilizing Cloud Compliance tools lie Astra and patching the virtual machines; implementing centralized monitoring and alerting systems across multiple cloud environments both AWS & Azure; using Docker containers and Kubernetes Containerized solutions both on-prem and on Cloud environments; utilizing CI/CD technologies using Jenkins pipeline build and deployments for automation and builds; using Terraform & CloudFormation for automated cloud infra deployments; using Data movement tools/technologies like SFTP, Connect Direct; building and configuring NIFI environments; and utilizing scripting languages like Shell, PowerSHell, Python, Bash.
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V *np*
JobCategory:Technology

company_overview: Data Analyst (Advanced) Government                    AT&T                                  Springfield, VA              On-site                8 hours ago               Full-time10,001+ employees · Telecommunications136 school alumniSee recent hiring trends for AT&T. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Data Analyst (Advanced) Government at AT&T
Title: Data Analyst (Advanced) Government
JD:
About the job
    


          AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Federal Government. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing, and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values, and dedicated to our customers’ mission.
AT&T has an opening for an Data Analyst (Advanced) to support the Intelligence Sector. The Data Analyst examines data from multiple disparate sources with the goal of providing security and privacy insight. Designs and implements custom algorithms, workflow processes and layouts for complex, enterprise-scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.
The job duties of the Data Analyst are as follows: 
Analyze and define data requirements and specifications.Analyze and plan for anticipated changes in data capacity requirements.Develop data standards, policies, and procedures.Manage the compilation, cataloging, caching, distribution, and retrieval of data.Provide a managed flow of relevant information (via web-based portals or other means) based on mission requirements.Provide recommendations on new database technologies and architectures.Analyze data sources to provide actionable recommendations.Assess the validity of source data and subsequent findings.Collect metrics and trending data.Conduct hypothesis testing using statistical processes.Confer with systems analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design application.Develop and facilitate data-gathering methods, Develop strategic insights from large data sets.Present technical information to technical and nontechnical audiences and Present data in creative formats.Provide actionable recommendations to critical stakeholders based on data analysis and findings.Utilize open source language such as R and apply quantitative techniques (e.g., descriptive and inferential statistics, sampling, experimental design, parametric and non-parametric tests of difference, ordinary least squares regression, general line).Develop and implement data mining and data warehousing programs.Knowledge of transformation analytics (e.g., aggregation, enrichment, processing), data pre-processing (e.g., imputation, dimensionality reduction, normalization, transformation, extraction, filtering, smoothing).

Required Clearance:
TS/SCI with poy (#ts/sci) (#polygraph)
Required Qualifications:
 
Candidate must have 10 years of experience that can be a combination of work history and education. This equates to:Bachelor and 7 yearsHS and 9 years
Must have one of the following certifications to meet minimum requirements for DoD 8570 IAT Level 3 certification requirements:Certified Chief Information Security Officer Certification (CCISO)Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)Cisco Certified Network Professional Security (CCNP Security)CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner (CASP+)GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED)GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH)GIAC Security Expert (GSE)GIAC Security Leadership (GSLC)ISACA Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)SCP Security Certified Network Architect (SCNA)


Desired Qualifications:
Leadership, soft skills (experience with customer briefings), highly organized, problem solving, and self-motivated.
Ready to join our team? Apply Today!
JobCategory:Technology

company_overview: Data Analyst QS1 (Government)                    AT&T                                  Columbia, MD              On-site                3 weeks ago                                    7 applicants                    Full-time10,001+ employees · Telecommunications136 school alumniSee how you compare to 7 applicants. Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Data Analyst QS1 (Government) at AT&T
Title: Data Analyst QS1 (Government)
JD:
About the job
    


          AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Department of Defense. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers’ mission.
RIS I is the delivery of regional IT services to the end user. We offer support of end user devices including desktop, workplace peripherals, and voice and video devices. We support local and campus area networks, including wireless and cable plant.
AT&T has an opening for a SLA Manager/Data Analyst to be responsible for SLA Measurement & Reporting, Improvement of Service quality, Root Cause Analysis of service levels and other service delivery metrics, Auditing and Risk Management for a large IT services contract.
The job duties of the Data Analyst are as follows:
Creating and maintaining views into data sets for analysis and visualization.Developing and implement data gathering, analysis, and reporting capabilities.Collaborating with the service managers and the design and engineering and tools teams to collect and process relevant metrics to support service level management and process improvement activities.Preparing periodic reports to communicate outcomes of analytic activities.Performing analytics on discrepancies and issues and performing root cause analysis.Identifying people, process, and technology opportunities for efficiency and cost reductions.Identifies the key objectives of gathering data and key sources of needed information and applies data-gathering methods.Assesses common problems and obstacles surrounding data-gathering.Interprets and explains results of a data-gathering initiative.Analyzes complex reports as revealed by the data.Prepares cost-benefit analyses of alternative approaches.Reviews and verifies data and reports for accuracy and evaluates errors in data results and data reports.Assists in assessing risks, benefits and consideration of alternatives.Participates in documenting data, ideas, players, stakeholders, and processes.Differentiates between assumptions, perspectives, and historical frameworks.Recognizes, clarifies, and prioritizes concerns.Identifies issues and communicates with decision makers when a decision needs to be made and analyzes and discusses alternatives.Contributes to documents on the results of the analyzed data.Predicts trends based on patterns found in data reports.Describes alternative data-gathering techniques and collaborates in the selection and implementation of analysis tools and methodologies.

Required Clearance: Clearable. Able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance with polygraph. (#ts/sci) (#polygraph)
Required Qualifications: Five years experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity within the Federal Government. Preferred Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering, Math, or Science or equivalent experience.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills.Experience in critical thinking and decision-making, the ability to analyze situations fully and accurately and the ability to reach productive decisions.Self-motivated and results-oriented.Working experience with ServiceNOW and/or Splunk.Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and other MS Office tools.ITIL Foundations v3 or v4 certification desirable.

Ready to join our team? Apply Today!
JobCategory:Corporate
